citations.narrative:
In the third pen of the main barn area, there is a gate with two horizontal bars separated from the vertical post and
protruding into the pen. These protruding bars pose a potential safety hazard to the animals. The gate must be
maintained in good repair to protect the animals from injury.

One nursing pig was observed in a farrowing crate that restricted forward and backward movement while also restricting
the ability to turn around or make similar adjustments, though the pig otherwise appeared normal. The licensee expressed
that while the pig was due to be moved to a pen within the next few days, the pig has been maintained in the crate for
approximately 8 days. Farrowing crates do not provide for adequate freedom of movement or for the ability to make
normal postural and social adjustments. Enclosures must provide sufficient space to allow for these behaviors.
Correct by October 31, 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
